episodeTitle: Luffy and Ace! The Story of How the Brothers Met!
description: Ten years before the main story, young Luffy is brought by Garp to live with the mountain bandit Curly Dadan, where he meets Ace. Despite Ace's hostility, Luffy persistently follows him for three months through dangerous terrain, eventually discovering the Gray Terminal.

events.title: Curly Dadan's First Appearance
events.description: Curly Dadan, leader of the Dadan Family mountain bandits, is introduced when Garp brings young Luffy to her house on Mt. Colubo. She protests having to raise both Ace and Luffy, but Garp coerces her by threatening to expose her illegal activities.
events.significance: Establishes Dadan as the foster mother who raised both Luffy and Ace under Garp's orders, providing crucial context for their childhood bond.

quotes.text: I can't possibly raise both of them!
quotes.speaker: Curly Dadan
quotes.context: Protesting Garp's order to take care of Luffy in addition to Ace

events.title: Dogra and Magra's First Appearance
events.description: Dogra and Magra, two members of the Dadan Family mountain bandits, appear alongside Dadan when Garp arrives with Luffy.
events.significance: Introduces key members of the bandit family who will be part of Luffy and Ace's childhood environment.

events.title: Luffy Meets Ace
events.description: Young Luffy meets 10-year-old Ace for the first time at Dadan's house. The two boys glare at each other with hostility, with Ace clearly unhappy about Luffy's arrival.
events.significance: This is the beginning of the legendary brotherhood between Luffy and Ace, showing their relationship started with animosity before growing into deep brotherly love.

events.title: Luffy Decides to Follow Ace
events.description: Despite Ace's clear hostility and attempts to lose him, young Luffy decides to persistently follow Ace every day to become friends with him.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's determination and unwavering spirit even as a child, traits that define his character throughout the series.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy calling out as he follows Ace through the forest

events.title: Luffy's Three-Month Pursuit
events.description: The episode montages Luffy following Ace through hazardous obstacles for three continuous months. Ace leads him through rivers filled with crocodiles, encounters with wild tigers and bears, venomous snakes, and other dangers, trying to discourage Luffy from following him.
events.significance: Shows the extreme lengths young Luffy went through to earn Ace's friendship, foreshadowing his determination and resilience as a pirate.

events.title: Luffy Discovers Gray Terminal
events.description: After following Ace for three months, Luffy finally reaches the end of the forest and discovers Gray Terminal, a massive junkyard filled with disease and crime. This is where Ace has been going every day.
events.significance: Gray Terminal becomes a crucial location in the brothers' backstory and where they will meet their third brother, Sabo. The location represents the harsh reality of the Goa Kingdom's society.

events.title: Flashback to Luffy and Ace's First Meeting
events.description: The episode reveals through flashback how Luffy and Ace first met ten years before the main story, providing context for their deep brotherly bond that was central to the Marineford War.
events.significance: This flashback arc helps viewers understand the depth of Luffy's grief over Ace's death and the foundation of their brotherhood, which is essential to Luffy's character development.

quotes.text: I can't possibly raise both of them!
quotes.speaker: Curly Dadan
quotes.context: Protesting to Garp about having to care for both Ace and Luffy

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Calling out as he follows Ace through the dangerous forest

themes.description: The episode explores the beginning of Luffy and Ace's brotherhood, showing how their bond was forged through Luffy's persistence and determination to befriend Ace despite initial rejection.
themes.symbolism: The three-month journey through hazardous terrain symbolizes the trials necessary to build true friendship and family bonds.

themes.description: Young Luffy's unwavering determination to follow Ace for three months despite constant danger demonstrates the core trait that defines his character throughout the series.
themes.symbolism: The dangerous obstacles Luffy overcomes foreshadow the challenges he will face as a pirate pursuing his dream.

themes.description: The introduction of Gray Terminal, a junkyard filled with outcasts and refuse from the Goa Kingdom, begins to explore themes of social stratification and inequality that will be central to this arc.
themes.symbolism: Gray Terminal represents the hidden poverty and suffering that exists beneath the facade of the 'most beautiful kingdom in the East Blue.'

characterSpotlights.development: We see young Luffy's determination, resilience, and unwavering spirit in pursuing friendship with Ace, establishing the childhood foundation of his character.
keyActions: Meets Ace for the first time
Decides to follow Ace despite hostility
Endures three months of dangerous obstacles

characterSpotlights.development: Young Ace is shown as hostile and isolated, actively trying to discourage Luffy by leading him through deadly hazards, hinting at his troubled past.
keyActions: Shows hostility to Luffy upon first meeting
Attempts to lose Luffy by taking dangerous routes
Leads Luffy through hazardous obstacles for three months
Secretly allows Luffy to follow him to Gray Terminal

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a mountain bandit forced by Garp to raise Ace and Luffy. Despite her rough exterior and protests, she serves as their foster mother.
keyActions: Meets Luffy when Garp brings him to Mt. Colubo
Protests having to raise both boys
Reluctantly accepts Luffy under Garp's threat
quotes: I can't possibly raise both of them!

characterSpotlights.development: Garp's role as the one who arranged for both Ace and Luffy to be raised by Dadan is revealed, showing his protective nature toward the boys despite his Marine position.
keyActions: Brings young Luffy to Dadan's house
Coerces Dadan into raising Luffy by threatening to expose her crimes

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on Luffy's three-month journey following Ace with extended sequences of him encountering various dangerous animals and obstacles, while the manga portrayed this more briefly.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Fight Together' by Namie Amuro as the opening theme song.
Episode 493 marks the beginning of the extended flashback arc showing Luffy's childhood with Ace and Sabo, providing emotional context following Ace's death in the Marineford War.
The episode aired on April 10, 2011, approximately nine months after the emotional climax of Ace's death in Episode 483.
Gray Terminal is described as a massive junkyard that smells from burning in the sun and is filled with disease and crime, representing the dark underbelly of the Goa Kingdom.
